title: Why does the Google Maps satellite version hide the ocean? - Quora

response.answer_text: You can always use Google Earth if you want to see the surface of the ocean or the 3D modelling of the sea floor. But since Google has to buy their satellite imagery from those with the satellites, it would be wasteful to spend money on areas that have no land, only featureless surface of the ocean. Which, I’m sure you know, is most of the planet. Including the ocean surface would triple the costs of buying the imagery for Google.

They do have satellite view of the whole world, try it, but they only have plane images (much better quality) of land, for example go to an island in the sea such as Hawaii and you will sea not far from the coast the image becomes a lot less high resolution. This is of course because a few satellite pictures are much cheaper that planes which only photograph small areas at a time.
